results.title: Video sound
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode looks at background noise and how to reduce it. It explains the uses of single, wide or omni-directional microphones, extension mikes and their placement (especially with interviews or music), directional mikes and how to use them together effectively.

results.title: Video maker
results.creator_credit: Scott Young, Alliance Productions, Nine Network (Australia) and Shane Yeend
results.brief_description: Video maker is designed to help transform the confused home video operator into a budding video director. This tape looks at topics such as focus, handheld and zoom, camera editing, depth of field and exposure as well as looking at terminology, different filming techniques and equipment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Young, Alliance Productions, Nine Network (Australia) and Shane Yeend

results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Video 50
results.creator_credit: Robert Boner, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Wilson and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Video 50 is an extraordinary video sketchbook, a highly original, visually dramatic and frequently humorous collection of one hundred abbreviated ‘episodes’ produced for television. Unfolding as a series of thirty-second vignettes, this enigmatic essay in style is characterized by a deadpan theatricality, symbolist imagery, surrealist juxtapositions and repetition of key visual motifs. Indelible images, precisely composed — a man teetering above a waterfall, a floating chair, a winking eye, a parrot against the New York skyline — are accompanied by an ‘architectural’ sound score that includes spoken ‘phonetic patterns’ rather than words. Fusing his surprising visual logic and rhythms with unexpected temporal manipulations, Wilson creates a work of startling wit and poetry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Boner, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Wilson and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)
results.description: Video 50 is an extraordinary video sketchbook, a highly original, visually dramatic and frequently humorous collection of one hundred abbreviated ‘episodes’ produced for television. Unfolding as a series of thirty-second vignettes, this enigmatic essay in style is characterized by a deadpan theatricality, symbolist imagery, surrealist juxtapositions and repetition of key visual motifs. Indelible images, precisely composed — a man teetering above a waterfall, a floating chair, a winking eye, a parrot against the New York skyline — are accompanied by an ‘architectural’ sound score that includes spoken ‘phonetic patterns’ rather than words. Fusing his surprising visual logic and rhythms with unexpected temporal manipulations, Wilson creates a work of startling wit and poetry.

Unfolding as a series of thirty-second vignettes, this enigmatic essay in style is characterized by a deadpan theatricality, symbolist imagery, surrealist juxtapositions and repetition of key visual motifs. Indelible images, precisely composed — a man teetering above a waterfall, a floating chair, a winking eye, a parrot against the New York skyline — are accompanied by an ‘architectural’ sound score that includes spoken ‘phonetic patterns’ rather than words. Fusing his surprising visual logic and rhythms with unexpected temporal manipulations, Wilson creates a work of startling wit and poetry.
